body: that's the cursor that your IME indicates. Usually when it's at the last position of the word it's not shown.
@kchibisov Feel free to close if you think this is an IME bug.

> Need `alacritty --print-events` to say for sure.
Thanks! Here's the log.
[alacritty.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17365162/alacritty.log)

@purejoy how does it look inside the e.g. `konsole` or `gnome-terminal` if you have any of them around?


Basically IME says that the cursor is from start to end, and yes we just draw it for the start of the editing area.

issue.title: Implement multi-char cursor highlight
issue.body:
Use `end` of the cursor to draw a `HollowBlock` from `start` to `end`. When cursor covers only a single character, use `Beam` cursor instead of `HollowBlock`.

Fixes #8238.
Fixes #7849.

body:
I've opened https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/pull/8239 which should make it look like on a comment with 元気。You'll just have the same hollow block cursor around all your string since IME reports that you have cursor(selection) from start to finish.

That's how other terminals I've tested show it, though, maybe not vte ones.

> @purejoy how does it look inside the e.g. `konsole` or `gnome-terminal` if you have any of them around?
> 
> Basically IME says that the cursor is from start to end, and yes we just draw it for the start of the editing area.

Typing Chinese in Konsole appears normal, without this issue.

konsole
![2024-10-15_09-26](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/28383a27-dc7b-4dd5-8743-9aaff23ff351)

> You'll just have the same hollow block cursor around all your string since IME reports that you have cursor(selection) > from start to finish.

How about to set the background color of the text  or just the underline text instead of the hollow block?  It seems to result in consistent behavior across various apps. 

Microsoft Edge
![2024-10-15_09-32](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/63f73898-6cdd-41d9-9647-a0755301da96)

VS Code
![2024-10-15_09-58](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/066fd731-089f-4aff-97b7-d4b76e001481)
Yeah, so they all select the text (just differently). Our block thing you see is the selection.
